Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no senator named James Montgomery and no serial killer named Anne Marie Scott.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Anne Marie Scott, the fictional daughter of Senator James Montgomery, was charged with 14 counts of first-degree murder and that the victims were torn limb from limb and fed to her collection of deadly reptiles.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is entirely fabricated and there is no evidence or factual basis for the charges or the existence of the individuals involved.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes the existence of a senator named James Montgomery and a serial killer named Anne Marie Scott without any basis in reality.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the claim is a satirical fabrication published by the Last Line of Defense, a known satirical website.
